page.description: Definition of a line in a layout in the control bar.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of line. A value of "custom" will use the supplied "html" property as the template for the contents of the line. The default value of "default" will use "before", "middle" and "after".

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the element that contains the layout line.

property.name: style
property.description: The inline CSS to put on the element that contains the layout line.

property.name: show
property.description: The show expression for the layout line.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to use as a template for the custom layout line type. Items can be injected into the HTML for the line by placing the item name between "[" and "]" (for example a item with the name "title" would be injected by placing "[title]" in the HTML).

property.name: before
property.description: The "before" part of the default layout line type. In a horizontal layout this will be left, in a vertical top.

property.name: items
property.description: An array of item names to show in the "before" part. Separators can be specified by a "-", while a spacer can be made with a CSS size between a "<" and ">". For example "< 50px >".

property.name: middle
property.description: The "middle" part of the default layout line type.

property.name: items
property.description: An array of item names to show in the "middle" part. Separators can be specified by a "-", while a spacer can be made with a CSS size between a "<" and ">". For example "< 50px >".

property.name: after
property.description: The "after" part of the default layout line type. In a horizontal layout this will be right, in a vertical bottom.

property.name: items
property.description: An array of item names to show in the "after" part. Separators can be specified by a "-", while a spacer can be made with a CSS size between a "<" and ">". For example "< 50px >".
